alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 10 at 9:37PM AKST until December 11 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. North to East winds gusting 25 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibilities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are expected this afternoon through this evening. Somewhat warmer temperatures will arrive this evening, but there is uncertainty in whether it will warm enough to cause precipitation to mix with or change to rain. The most likely place to see some rain is in Homer near sea level.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
